result.execSummary:
The defendant Allison Elizabeth Schoenoff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Allison Elizabeth Schoenoff is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Allison Elizabeth Schoenoff was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 5 and 6.
Defendant to report to Probation no later than 3:00 p.m. today November 19, 2015.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.
Court notes 105 days credit if revoked.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 4 Case #15CF282.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 4 Case #15CF282.

-Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and the Agent.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Isaac Rayfield.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Allison Elizabeth Schoenoff appeared. Case called at 10:01 a.m. ADA Minser files an amended information today and recites agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to amended Ct 4 Possession of Methamphetamine as party to a crime in 15CF282. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 4 Possession of Methamphetamine as party to a crime in 15CF282. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct's 5 & 6 in 15CF282. Sentencing arguments. Defendant makes statements. Crt orders:

-   S/W 2 years probation. Must report to probation by no later than 3 p.m. today. Bond will remain in effect until defendant reports. 105 days jail credit if revoked. 

-   Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Isaac Rayfield. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  

- AODA and follow through with any recommendations 

- DNA Sample, Court Costs and DNA Surcharge


Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-19-2015 10:00 am

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF281 and 15CF282:

Defendant will be finished with treatment in November. Atty Chapman states there is no pending motions, will do plea today  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.

- Sign a release for the state to obtain information from the treatment center

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF282 and 15CF281:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson. Atty Chapman appears via phone.    DF:  Allison Elizabeth Schoenoff appeared from jail. DF: Isaac Rayfield appeared from jail. Case called at 9:13 a.m. On case 15CF281 Atty Chapman states that no offer has been extended yet. Hoping for a resolution. 15CF282 Atty Harrelson states defendant is trying to get into a treatment facility and may need a bond review hearing in the future if she can get into a facility. Defendant's father is present and would be her transport. Would like a motion hearing set and will be filing motions in the next couple days. Court directs Atty Harrelson to have motions filed by the end of the week. Bond continues.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference at 09-21-2015 09:00 am

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Allison Elizabeth Schoenoff appeared from jail. Case called at 11:17 a.m. ADA McKinley states defendant was looking into Rule 25 and treatment. Atty Harrelson states defendant has been working with program staff in the jail and Rule 25 coordinator will be coming to the jail. May be requesting a suppression motion. State does not oppose. Co-defendant's have not been severed to her knowledge. Court will set the date with the other files of the co-defendant's and if any motions are to be filed, a motion hearing date will be set at that time.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference at 08-20-2015 11:15 am

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Allison Elizabeth Schoenoff appeared from jail. Case called at 9:02 a.m. ADA McKinley states defendant was looking into Rule 25 in MN. Atty Harrelson states defendant completed the application. Requesting a brief furlough to transfer to treatment facility for an assessment. Defendant's father would comply with the transport. ADA McKinley states date and time need to be confirmed before furlough granted. No objection for a request in writing. Court would need the details, Atty Harrelson would need to make a Motion to Modify Bond in writing. Does not need to appear in court. Needs dates, times, names and addresses and information regarding father. Atty Harrelson has not received discovery yet. Court if motions are to be filed, file prior to ptc date.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 11:15 am.
Filed by ADA McKinley. km

Court reviews file. Atty. Harrelson updates the court.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights on counts 4, 5 and 6. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG to all counts.  Waives speedy trial. Atty. Harrelson updates the court as to treatment possibilities she does not have an appt. at this time. ADA McKinely requests a status. CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Amber L Hahn   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Isaac John Rayfield appeared from jail and Allison Schoenoff appeared from jail. DF ATTY: Jeremiah Harrelson. Case called at 9:10 a.m. ADA Hahn calls Investigator Haefner to the stand. S/T Investigator James Haefner employed with St Croix Co. Sheriff's Dept.  Direct by ADA Hahn. Identifies both defendants in the courtroom. Cross by Atty Chapman. Cross by Atty Harrelson. No redirect by the state. Witness excused. ADA Hahn calls Investigator Mikla to the stand. S/T Investigator Mikla employed with the St Croix Co. Sheriff's Dept. Direct by ADA Hahn. Cross by Atty Chapman. Cross by Atty Harrelson. No redirect by the state. Witness excused. Nothing further by the state. Court finds probable cause on both cases that a felony has been committed and bind both defendant's over for trial. ADA Hahn does not have an information to file today. State's that Mr. Rayfield is on a PO Hold. Atty Chapman confirms and requests to set out 30 days. Atty Harrelson would like to request a modification for bond. Atty Chapman does not request a speedy demand.  Arraignment scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Bail/bond hearing on June 29, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
to Dismiss Defective Complaint filed by Atty Kucinski. eif
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2015 at 09:15 am.

CO: EJL for RMW, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Francis D. Collins, DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,   DF:  Allison Elizabeth Schoenoff appeared.  Atty Kucinski filed a Defective Complaint Motion.  ADA Collins believes motion should be reserved until Prelim, Atty Kucinski argues. Court notes Motion to dismiss is Denied. Bond continues in form and amount.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 09:15 am.
Bail/bond hearing on June 19, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  David B. or his property.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: RMW, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Francis D. Collins & Ryan Moertel,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,   DF:  Allison Elizabeth Schoenoff appeared from jail. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Prelim requested.  Atty Kucinski would like to know what substance she is charged with having and on maintaining a drug house.  Objections are reserved. State is requesting $10,000.00 CB, Atty Kucinski argues.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
